docstr:
`LSTAT` â€” Get file status ### Description `LSTAT` is identical to STAT, except that if path is a symbolic link, then the link itself is statted, not the file that it refers to. The elements in `VALUES` are the same as described by STAT. This intrinsic is provided in both subroutine and function forms; however, only one form can be used in any given program unit. ### Syntax | `STATUS = LSTAT(NAME, VALUES)`
### Arguments of the default kind, a valid path within the file system. | `VALUES` | The type shall be `INTEGER(4), DIMENSION(13)`. | `STATUS` | (Optional) status flag of type `INTEGER(4)`. Returns 0 on success and a system specific error code otherwise. ### Example See STAT for an example. ### Standard GNU extension ### Class Subroutine, function ### See also To stat an open file: FSTAT, to stat a file: STAT
